Events.text: Tyre falls to the Crusaders.
Events.html: Tyre falls to the Crusaders.

Events.text: A retrial verdict acquits Joan of Arc of heresy 25 years after her death.
Events.html: A retrial verdict acquits Joan of Arc of heresy 25 years after her death.

Events.text: Spanish conquistadores defeat a larger Aztec army at the Battle of Otumba.
Events.html: Spanish conquistadores defeat a larger Aztec army at the Battle of Otumba.

Events.text: Jacques Cartier makes his first contact with aboriginal peoples in what is now Canada.
Events.html: Jacques Cartier makes his first contact with aboriginal peoples in what is now Canada.

Events.text: The Raid of the Redeswire is the last major battle between England and Scotland.
Events.html: The Raid of the Redeswire is the last major battle between England and Scotland.

Events.text: The Treaty of Nemours abolishes tolerance to Protestants in France.
Events.html: The Treaty of Nemours abolishes tolerance to Protestants in France.

Events.text: The Battle of Larga between the Russian Empire and the Ottoman Empire takes place.
Events.html: The Battle of Larga between the Russian Empire and the Ottoman Empire takes place.

Events.text: American forces retreating from Fort Ticonderoga are defeated in the Battle of Hubbardton.
Events.html: American forces retreating from Fort Ticonderoga are defeated in the Battle of Hubbardton.

Events.text: As a result of the XYZ Affair, the U.S. Congress rescinds the Treaty of Alliance with France sparking the "Quasi-War".
Events.html: As a result of the XYZ Affair, the U.S. Congress rescinds the Treaty of Alliance with France sparking the "Quasi-War".

Events.text: The Peace of Tilsit between France, Prussia and Russia ends the War of the Fourth Coalition.
Events.html: The Peace of Tilsit between France, Prussia and Russia ends the War of the Fourth Coalition.

Events.text: In New York City, four nights of rioting against abolitionists began.
Events.html: In New York City, four nights of rioting against abolitionists began.

Events.text: American troops occupy Monterey and Yerba Buena, thus beginning the conquest of California.
Events.html: American troops occupy Monterey and Yerba Buena, thus beginning the conquest of California.

Events.text: The United States begins its first military draft; exemptions cost $300.
Events.html: The United States begins its first military draft; exemptions cost $300.

Events.text: Four conspirators in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln are hanged.
Events.html: Four conspirators in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln are hanged.

Events.text: The Katipunan is established, the discovery of which by Spanish authorities initiated the Philippine Revolution.
Events.html: The Katipunan is established, the discovery of which by Spanish authorities initiated the Philippine Revolution.

Events.text: U.S. President William McKinley signs the Newlands Resolution annexing Hawaii as a territory of the United States.
Events.html: U.S. President William McKinley signs the Newlands Resolution annexing Hawaii as a territory of the United States.

Events.text: Florenz Ziegfeld, Jr. staged his first Follies on the roof of the New York Theater in New York City.
Events.html: Florenz Ziegfeld, Jr. staged his first Follies on the roof of the New York Theater in New York City.

Events.text: The United States, Great Britain, Japan, and Russia sign the North Pacific Fur Seal Convention of 1911 banning open-water seal hunting, the first international treaty to address wildlife preservation issues.
Events.html: The United States, Great Britain, Japan, and Russia sign the North Pacific Fur Seal Convention of 1911 banning open-water seal hunting, the first international treaty to address wildlife preservation issues.

links.title: North Pacific Fur Seal Convention of 1911

Events.text: The First Battle of the Isonzo comes to an end.
Events.html: The First Battle of the Isonzo comes to an end.

Events.text: An International Railway trolley with an extreme overload of 157 passengers crashes near Queenston, Ontario, killing 15.
Events.html: 1915 – An International Railway trolley with an extreme overload of 157 passengers crashes near Queenston, Ontario, killing 15.

Events.text: Colombo Town Guard officer Henry Pedris is executed in British Ceylon for allegedly inciting persecution of Muslims.
Events.html: 1915 – Colombo Town Guard officer Henry Pedris is executed in British Ceylon for allegedly inciting persecution of Muslims.

Events.text: The New Zealand Labour Party was founded in Wellington.
Events.html: The New Zealand Labour Party was founded in Wellington.

Events.text: Sliced bread is sold for the first time (on the inventor's 48th birthday) by the Chillicothe Baking Company of Chillicothe, Missouri.
Events.html: Sliced bread is sold for the first time (on the inventor's 48th birthday) by the Chillicothe Baking Company of Chillicothe, Missouri.

Events.text: Industrialist Henry J. Kaiser begins construction of Boulder Dam (now known as Hoover Dam).
Events.html: Industrialist Henry J. Kaiser begins construction of Boulder Dam (now known as Hoover Dam).

Events.text: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, the creator of Sherlock Holmes, dies.
Events.html: 1930 – Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, the creator of Sherlock Holmes, dies.

Events.text: The Marco Polo Bridge Incident provides the Imperial Japanese Army with a pretext for starting the Second Sino-Japanese War.
Events.html: The Marco Polo Bridge Incident provides the Imperial Japanese Army with a pretext for starting the Second Sino-Japanese War.

Events.text: The Peel Commission Report recommends the partition of Palestine - the first formal recommendation for partition in the history of Palestine
Events.html: The Peel Commission Report recommends the partition of Palestine - the first formal recommendation for partition in the history of Palestine

Events.text: The American occupation of Iceland replaces the British occupation.
Events.html: The American occupation of Iceland replaces the British occupation.

Events.text: World War II: Beirut is occupied by Free France and British troops.
Events.html: 1941 – World War II: Beirut is occupied by Free France and British troops.

Events.text: World War II: Largest Banzai charge of the Pacific War at the Battle of Saipan.
Events.html: World War II: Largest Banzai charge of the Pacific War at the Battle of Saipan.

Events.text: Mother Francesca S. Cabrini becomes the first American to be canonized.
Events.html: Mother Francesca S. Cabrini becomes the first American to be canonized.

Events.text: Howard Hughes nearly dies when his XF-11 reconnaissance aircraft prototype crashes in a Beverly Hills neighborhood.
Events.html: 1946 – Howard Hughes nearly dies when his XF-11 reconnaissance aircraft prototype crashes in a Beverly Hills neighborhood.

Events.text: The ocean liner SS United States passes Bishop Rock on her maiden voyage, breaking the transatlantic speed record to become the fastest passenger ship in the world.
Events.html: The ocean liner SS United States passes Bishop Rock on her maiden voyage, breaking the transatlantic speed record to become the fastest passenger ship in the world.

Events.text: Ernesto "Che" Guevara sets out on a trip through Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, Panama, Costa Rica, Nicaragua, Honduras, and El Salvador.
Events.html: Ernesto "Che" Guevara sets out on a trip through Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, Panama, Costa Rica, Nicaragua, Honduras, and El Salvador.

Events.text: Elvis Presley makes his radio debut when WHBQ Memphis played his first recording for Sun Records, "That's All Right".
Events.html: Elvis Presley makes his radio debut when WHBQ Memphis played his first recording for Sun Records, "That's All Right".

Events.text: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower signs the Alaska Statehood Act into law.
Events.html: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower signs the Alaska Statehood Act into law.

Events.text: Venus occults the star Regulus. This rare event is used to determine the diameter of Venus and the structure of the Venusian atmosphere.
Events.html: Venus occults the star Regulus. This rare event is used to determine the diameter of Venus and the structure of the Venusian atmosphere.

Events.text: Buddhist crisis: The police of Ngô Đình Nhu, brother and chief political adviser of President Ngô Đình Diệm, attacked a group of American journalists who were covering a protest.
Events.html: Buddhist crisis: The police of Ngô Đình Nhu, brother and chief political adviser of President Ngô Đình Diệm, attacked a group of American journalists who were covering a protest.

Events.text: The Solomon Islands becomes independent from the United Kingdom
Events.html: The Solomon Islands becomes independent from the United Kingdom

Events.text: Institution of sharia law in Iran.
Events.html: Institution of sharia law in Iran.

Events.text: During the Lebanese Civil War, 83 Tiger militants are killed during what will be known as the Safra massacre.
Events.html: 1980 – During the Lebanese Civil War, 83 Tiger militants are killed during what will be known as the Safra massacre.

Events.text: U.S. President Ronald Reagan appoints Sandra Day O'Connor to become the first female member of the Supreme Court of the United States.
Events.html: U.S. President Ronald Reagan appoints Sandra Day O'Connor to become the first female member of the Supreme Court of the United States.

links.title: Supreme Court of the United States

Events.text: Cold War: Samantha Smith, a U.S. schoolgirl, flies to the Soviet Union at the invitation of Secretary General Yuri Andropov.
Events.html: Cold War: Samantha Smith, a U.S. schoolgirl, flies to the Soviet Union at the invitation of Secretary General Yuri Andropov.

links.title: List of leaders of the Soviet Union

Events.text: Boris Becker becomes the youngest player ever to win Wimbledon at age 17.
Events.html: Boris Becker becomes the youngest player ever to win Wimbledon at age 17.

Events.text: Yugoslav Wars: The Brioni Agreement ends the ten-day independence war in Slovenia against the rest of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
Events.html: Yugoslav Wars: The Brioni Agreement ends the ten-day independence war in Slovenia against the rest of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.

Events.text: The New York Court of Appeals rules that women have the same right as men to go topless in public.
Events.html: The New York Court of Appeals rules that women have the same right as men to go topless in public.

Events.text: The Turkish Armed Forces withdraw from northern Iraq after assisting the Kurdistan Democratic Party in the Iraqi Kurdish Civil War.
Events.html: The Turkish Armed Forces withdraw from northern Iraq after assisting the Kurdistan Democratic Party in the Iraqi Kurdish Civil War.

Events.text: NASA Opportunity rover, MER-B or Mars Exploration Rover–B, was launched into space aboard a Delta II rocket.
Events.html: NASA Opportunity rover, MER-B or Mars Exploration Rover–B, was launched into space aboard a Delta II rocket.

Events.text: A series of four explosions occurs on London's transport system, killing 56 people, including four suicide bombers, and injuring over 700 others.
Events.html: A series of four explosions occurs on London's transport system, killing 56 people, including four suicide bombers, and injuring over 700 others.

Events.text: The first Live Earth benefit concert was held in 11 locations around the world.
Events.html: The first Live Earth benefit concert was held in 11 locations around the world.

Events.text: At least 172 people are killed in a flash flood in the Krasnodar Krai region of Russia.
Events.html: At least 172 people are killed in a flash flood in the Krasnodar Krai region of Russia.

Events.text: A De Havilland Otter air taxi crashes in Soldotna, Alaska, killing ten people.
Events.html: A De Havilland Otter air taxi crashes in Soldotna, Alaska, killing ten people.

Events.text: Former U.S. Army soldier Micah Xavier Johnson shoots fourteen policemen during an anti-police protest in downtown Dallas, Texas, killing five of them. He is subsequently killed by a robot-delivered bomb.
Events.html: Former U.S. Army soldier Micah Xavier Johnson shoots fourteen policemen during an anti-police protest in downtown Dallas, Texas, killing five of them. He is subsequently killed by a robot-delivered bomb.
